intro: Stefanoffia insoluta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flower colors, which range from pink to purple and white.
